Comments_List: This was an exceptionally thorough courses that approaches Thucydides from a historical, literary, and history of reception standpoint. Students became literate in one of the most difficult Ancient Greek authors, while also asking larger questions about the nature of history.

This course was astounding in the in depth close readings as well as class discussions. All students were interested and participated. Both the specifics of grammar and nuances of daily life in Athens were addressed. Most importantly, Thucydides was approaches from an array of scholarly perspectives and students were given the opportunity to engage with the text in many different ways.
yes! I learned a lot that is broadly applicable to the study of classics and history and one should take any chance to learn from Professor Greenwood.
I would highly recommend this course to any student with an appropriate level of Ancient Greek. If you do not have a strong grasp of Greek grammar, it will likely be painful.
